revised_title: Erosion Resistance of Materials in Steam Turbines and its Relation to Rain Damage in Aircraft and Missiles
tldr: The authors investigated the resistance of materials to impact erosion damage caused by water droplets in steam turbines, aircraft, and missiles. They tested various materials and found that some alloys, like cast cobalt-chromium, offer better erosion resistance than others. The study also showed that the rate of erosion depends on factors like impact velocity, angle of incidence, and drop size.
